title: Smart College System ‚Äî Responsive AI-powered college management website with feature showcase and demos

requirements.text: Build a modern, responsive landing website named ‚ÄúSmart College System‚Äù with an academic blue/white theme, professional typography, card-based layout, icons, and smooth UI animations; ensure the full site works well on mobile and desktop.

quotes: Create a modern, responsive, and professional website called ‚ÄúSmart College System‚Äù
clean UI, academic color theme (blue/white), and be optimized for desktop and mobile. Use modern cards, icons, dashboards, and smooth animations.
the website should be working on both mobile as well as desktop

acceptanceCriteria: Site uses a consistent blue/white academic visual theme across all sections (backgrounds, surfaces, typography, buttons, and links).
Responsive layouts are implemented for common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop) without horizontal scrolling.
UI includes modern cards and icons for feature highlights.
Section transitions / element entrances include subtle smooth animations without harming performance or accessibility (prefers-reduced-motion respected).

requirements.text: Implement the landing page structure with the required sections and English user-facing text: Hero (with headline exactly ‚ÄúSmart College System ‚Äì AI-Powered Education Management‚Äù), Features (icons + brief explanations), Dashboard preview mockup section, Benefits section (Students / Faculty / Admin), About & Future Scope of AI in education, Contact form, and Footer with social links.

quotes:
Website Structure:
* Hero section with headline: ‚ÄúSmart College System ‚Äì AI-Powered Education Management‚Äù
* Feature sections with icons and brief explanations
* Dashboard preview / screenshots mockup
* Benefits section for Students, Faculty, and Admin
* About the system & future scope of AI in education
* Contact form and footer with social links

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section renders the exact headline string provided.
Each required section is present and reachable via scrolling; optional top navigation anchors (if added) scroll to the correct sections.
All user-facing copy is in English.
Footer contains at least 3 social links (placeholders allowed) and standard footer metadata (e.g., copyright).

requirements.text: Add feature showcase cards/tiles for the seven core modules, each with an icon and a concise description: AI Student Portal, AI Chatbot / Virtual Assistant, Smart Analytics Dashboard, AI Faculty Assistant, Face Recognition Attendance (Concept/Demo), Smart Admissions System, and Campus Intelligence.

acceptanceCriteria: All seven modules are shown with distinct icons and short descriptions.

Each module description mentions the specific capabilities stated by the user (e.g., attendance tracking/marks for Student Portal; courses/fees/timetable/exams/results/campus services for Chatbot; charts/trends/risk prediction for Analytics, etc.).
Layout remains readable and well-spaced on mobile and desktop (no cramped cards, no overflow).

requirements.text: Create a ‚ÄúDashboard Preview‚Äù section that visually demonstrates the platform with screenshot-style mockups (static images) and accompanying captions for student performance, attendance, notifications, and analytics.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard Preview section includes at least 2 mock screenshot panels and short captions describing what each panel represents.
Mockups render crisply on retina displays and scale down appropriately on mobile.

requirements.text: Add a ‚ÄúFace Recognition Attendance (Concept/Demo)‚Äù section that explains the AI-based face attendance workflow and includes camera UI-style mockup visuals plus a simple step-by-step workflow visualization (conceptual, not real face recognition).

quotes: Face Recognition Attendance (Concept/Demo) ‚Äì A demo section explaining AI-based facial recognition attendance with camera UI mockups and workflow visuals.

acceptanceCriteria: Section explicitly indicates this is a concept/demo and does not claim real biometric processing.
Camera UI mockup visual is displayed along with a clear multi-step workflow (e.g., Capture ‚Üí Detect ‚Üí Match ‚Üí Mark Attendance).

requirements.text: Include lightweight interactive demos (no external AI/LLM integration): (1) a Smart Admissions eligibility checker form (marks, category, course preference) that shows instant results client-side; (2) a Chatbot UI mock that answers a fixed set of FAQs about courses, fees, timetable, exams, results, and campus services.

quotes: Smart Admissions System ‚Äì AI-based eligibility checker for admissions using marks, category, and course preferences with instant results.
AI Chatbot / Virtual Assistant ‚Äì A conversational chatbot that answers queries related to courses, fees, timetable, exams, results, and campus services.

acceptanceCriteria: Admissions checker accepts inputs for marks, category, and course preference and returns an immediate eligibility outcome (rules can be simplified but must be deterministic and clearly explained in UI).
Chatbot mock supports at least 8 predefined Q&A intents spanning the listed topics; unknown queries receive a friendly fallback response.
No external API calls are used for AI responses.

requirements.text: Implement a Contact form that lets users submit name, email, subject, and message; persist submissions in the Motoko canister and show a clear success/error state in the UI.

quotes: Contact form and footer with social links

acceptanceCriteria: Contact form validates required fields and basic email format before submit.
On submit, the frontend calls the backend to store the message and displays a success confirmation state.
Backend exposes an update method to create a contact message and a query method to list messages (for future admin use); the UI does not need an admin page unless added incidentally.
Data persists across page reloads.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent, innovative, trustworthy visual direction suitable for a final-year project/startup MVP demo while staying within the requested academic blue/white palette; define a coherent set of UI tokens (primary/secondary colors, surface colors, typography scale, spacing, button styles) and use them throughout.

quotes: The website should feel innovative, trustworthy, and suitable for a final-year project, startup MVP, or college demo.

acceptanceCriteria: A single consistent visual system is evident across all sections (same button styles, same card treatments, consistent headings/body sizing).
Blue/white remains the dominant palette; any additional accent color is used sparingly and consistently.
Icons, cards, and charts feel cohesive and not mismatched in style.

requirements.text: Add static ‚ÄúSmart Analytics Dashboard‚Äù visuals (charts/graphs) illustrating student performance trends, risk prediction, and improvement suggestions (conceptual). Charts can be illustrative (static images or simple client-side chart rendering) but must not require external services.

quotes: Smart Analytics Dashboard ‚Äì Visual charts and graphs showing student performance trends, risk prediction, and academic improvement suggestions using AI.

acceptanceCriteria: Analytics section contains at least 2 chart-style visuals and short explanatory text for trends, risk prediction, and suggested improvements.
No third-party analytics/AI services are called from the app.

requirements.text: Add a simple top navigation (or sticky header) with links to major sections (Features, Dashboard, Benefits, About, Contact) and ensure accessibility basics (semantic headings, keyboard navigation, focus states, contrast).

quotes: Website Structure: ... Feature sections ... Benefits ... About ... Contact form ...

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation links scroll to the correct section anchors.
Interactive elements are keyboard accessible with visible focus states.
Headings follow a logical hierarchy (one H1, then H2s, etc.).
Color contrast is sufficient for primary text and buttons.

requirements.text: Render all generated image assets from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the UI (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: All images listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are used in the relevant sections.
No backend endpoints are created for image delivery.

constraints: Use React + TypeScript + Tailwind + Shadcn UI components via composition; do not edit files in frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if state migrations become necessary.
Do not integrate external AI/LLM services; chatbot and AI features must be conceptual or rule-based demos.
nonGoals: Implementing real face recognition, camera capture processing, or biometric storage.
Building a full production student information system (real student records, real attendance/marks ingestion).
Third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity (if login UI is added, it should be demo-only or II-based).
